meanings.definition: To straighten or unfold something that has been rolled up.
meanings.sent1: She unrolled the map to find the right direction.
meanings.sent2: He unrolled the sleeping bag before setting up the tent.
meanings.sent3: The magician unrolled the scroll to reveal his next trick.
meanings.sent4: As the story unrolled, the mystery slowly unfolded.
meanings.sent5: The carpet unrolled smoothly across the floor.

meanings.definition: To reveal or display something that was previously hidden or concealed.
meanings.sent1: The detective unrolled the evidence to solve the case.
meanings.sent2: She unrolled the poster to hang it on the wall.
meanings.sent3: The surprise gift unrolled to show a hidden message inside.
meanings.sent4: The drama unrolled as the truth came to light.
meanings.sent5: The treasure map unrolled to reveal the buried treasure location.
